Dear Mr. Griffus:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 07/18/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
COF Rule 400.10113 Employee records
(1) Employee records shall be maintained for each
employee and shall include all of the following
information:
(f) A written evaluation of the employee's
performance within the first 6 months of each
position designated by these rules and annually
thereafter.
Four of ten newly hired employee files reviewed were missing completed
evaluations that were dated within the first six months of the position.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was provided in the areas of tracking dates for
requirements such as employee performance reviews as well as clarification
on how to best capture the receipt of discipline and grievance policies for
newly placed youth.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided during this inspection in the areas of education
documentation for newly hired employees as well as the optimal utilization of a
new computer system for the facility.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one corrective action plan during this period under review in
response to the Interim inspection completed on 10/10/2022 which contained one
rule violation for narrative contained within resident reports at the time of
placement. A corrective action plan was submitted and approved on 10/11/2022.
The approved corrective action plan included updated training for staff on report
requirements as well as revisions to case management software that made certain
elements of the reports required in order to meet the rule. This corrective action
plan was followed and the facility had no repeated findings for this rule.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting and expense documentation for the facility was provided by the
overseeing organization and no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
A written assessment from the chief administrator is not required for COF facilities.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were completed on 07/18/2023. Staff reported positive
experiences working for the facility. A mix of staff that are within their first or
second year were interviewed as well as staff with more than ten years’
experience. Staff remarked on varied and beneficial trainings provided as well as
positive remarks about the administrative team. All staff interviewed felt they were

able to follow all the requirements of a juvenile detention center while still being
able to build rapport and relationships with the youth placed.
Youth interviews were completed on 07/11/2023. All youth reported feeling safe at
the facility. They stated that escalated incidents are rare but when they occur,
they felt like staff are able to contain them and other youth do not end up being
involved or victims. Youth stated that they felt like their basic needs are met
through adequate food and clothing.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Agency walk through was completed on 07/18/2023. Medications were viewed as
stored and organized properly. Cleaning supplies were in good supply and
properly stored. Bedrooms and living areas for youth were clean and free from any
safety concerns. It is noted that the facility is changing their name to the Midland
County Juvenile Justice Center as of this renewal inspection.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
